socio1.question: In which country do you work?

edu1.question: What is the highest qualification you have obtained?

edu2.question: In which subject is your highest academic qualification?

edu4.question: Do you hold any other professional qualifications?

rse1.question: Do you write code as part of your job?

rse3.question: Who uses the code that you write?

soft2can.question: Do you consider yourself a professional software developer?

soft1can.question: How many years of Software development experience do you have?

time1can.question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on software development (Please rate your answer between 1 to 10. 1 Being none at all and 10 being All your time.)

time2can.question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on Research

time3can.question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on Management

time4can.question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on Teaching

time5can.question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on Other activities

currentEmp1.question: What type of organisation do you work for?

currentEmp4.question: Which organisation do you work for?

currentEmp5.question: What is your official job title?

currentEmp6.question: Are you known in your group by a different job title? If so, please enter the job title you use

currentEmp12.question: Do you work full time or part time

currentEmp10.question: What type of contract are you employed on?

currentEmp9.question: When did you start your current contract

currentEmp11.question: What is the duration of your current contract?

currentEmp13.question: In which disciplines do you work (select as many as apply)

prevEmp1.question: Where was your previous job based?

prevEmp2.question: Rank the following factors dependent on how strongly they influenced your decision to accept your current position

currentWork1.question: Do you always work with the same researcher(s), or do you regularly change the researcher(s) you work with?

currentWork2.question: Do you work for a Research Software Group?

paper1.question: Has your software contributed to research that has been published in a journal or at a conference?

paper2.question: In general, when your software contributes to a paper, are you acknowledged in that paper?

paper3.question: Are you generally named as the main author of the paper?

paper4.question: Are you generally named as a co-author of the paper?

paper5.question: Are you generally acknowledged in the main text of the paper?

conf1can.question: Have you ever presented your software work at a conference or workshop?

proj1can.question: How many software projects are you currently involved in?

stability1.question: What is the bus factor of your most important software project?

stability2.question: Is there a technical hand-over plan for your most important software project?

proj4can.question: In general, what sort of testing do you conduct on your software? (check all that apply)

open01can.question: Have you ever released your software under an open-source licence?

open1can.question: How often do you release the software projects you've worked on under an open-source licence?

open03an.question: Have you ever used a Digital Object Identifier (DOI) to identify your software?

open3can.question: How often do you associate your software with a Digital Object Identifier (DOI)?

train1.question: Have you ever trained researchers in computational techniques?

train2.question: On average, how many times a year do you take part in providing training?

train3.question: What training programs are you involved with (comma separated list)  (For example, Software Carpentry, local university training, etc.)

fund1.question: Do you know the source of the funding used to support you and your current, largest project?

fund2.question: Which of the following sources are used to pay for your effort as an RSE/equivalent?

fund3.question: Which of the following sources are used to fund your current, largest project?

fund4.question: Which of the following sources were used to fund your current, largest project three years ago?

perfCheck1.question: Do you receive sufficient information on the results of your work?

perfCheck2.question: Does your work give you the opportunity to check on how well you are doing your work?

perfCheck3.question: In your work, do you have access to sufficient data and information?

perfCheck4.question: Do you receive sufficient information on the purpose of your work?

perfCheck5.question: Does your work provide you with direct feedback on how well you are doing your work?

perfCheck6.question: Does your supervisor/line manager inform you about how well you are doing your work?

perfCheck7.question: Do your colleagues inform you about how well you are doing your work?

turnOver1.question: How often do you feel frustrated when not given the opportunity to achieve your personal work-related goals?

turnOver2.question: How often do you look forward to another day at work?

turnOver3.question: How often do you consider leaving your job?

turnOver4.question: How often do dream about getting another job that will better suit your needs?

turnOver5.question: My current job satisfies my personal needs

turnOver6.question: I would accept another job at the same compensation level if I was offered it

affRec1.question: I am satisfied with my supervisor/line manager's confidence in me

affRec2.question: I am satisfied with a word of thanks from my supervisor/line manager

affRec3.question: I am satisfied with the recognition I receive from my supervisor/line manager for doing my job

affRec4.question: I am satisfied with the compliments from my supervisor/line manager concerning my work

affRec5.question: I am satisfied with the encouragement from my supervisor/line manager while doing my job

percEmp1.question: It would not be very difficult for me to get an equivalent job in a different organisation

percEmp2.question: I can think of a number of organisations that would probably offer me a job

percEmp3.question: My experience is in demand on the labour market

percEmp4.question: Given my qualifications and experience, getting a new job would not be very hard at all

affSat1.question: I find real enjoyment in my job

affSat2.question: Most days I am enthusiastic about my job

affSat3.question: I feel fairly well satisfied with my job

affSat4.question: I like my job better than the average person

satisgen1-1.question: In general, how satisfied are you with Your current position

satisgen1-2.question: In general, how satisfied are you with Your career

socio5.question: How would you describe your ethnic origin?  This refers to people who share the same cultural background and identity, not country of birth or nationality.

disa1.question: Do you have a condition that is defined as a disability by the Equality Act 2010*

socio4.question: Please select the range of your salary

tool2.question: What Operating System do you prefer to use at work?

tool4can.question: What programming languages do you use at work? (Select as many as apply)

ukrse1.question: Are you a member of the UK RSE Association? (Members are people who have signed up to the UK RSE mailing list)

ukrse2.question: How do you meet other RSEs?

skill2.question: What three skills would you like to acquire or improve to help your work as a Research Software Engineer? The skills can be technical and non-technical.

ukrse3.question: How did you learn the skills you need to become an RSE?
